cont.entity_a: No background noise. Comparable to wired headphones. Lack of bass depth is disappointing.
cont.entity_b: Not the greatest but works well. Better than TV speakers. Slight background hiss and occasional phase issues. Background hiss can be significant and distracting.

cont.entity_a: Impressive surround sound effect providing a theater-like experience. Good stereo decoding abilities including DTS.
cont.entity_b: Excellent digital sound with Dolby 5.1 surround.

cont.entity_a: Durability is an issue as the joint on the headpiece snaps easily.
Line-of-sight operation limits mobility; any obstruction cuts off sound.
cont.entity_b: Headphones cut out if you wander far from the base. Range is short and can drop signals even when near the receiver.

cont.entity_a: Rechargeable batteries and built-in recharger are included.
Expensive, but worth the price if bought on sale below $150. Headphones are pricy but provide great sound.
cont.entity_b: Affordable price for the features offered.

cont.entity_a: Volume is adjustable and strong with no static.
cont.entity_b: Volume control is difficult to find and use.

cont.entity_a: Requires careful transmitter placement for optimal performance.
cont.entity_b: Charging dock is tricky and frustrating to use.
Good for use with fiber optic connections.
